page.title: 04Manor farm, Plaitford
page.content: At manor farm in Plaitford there is a moot where saxons used to meet.In the middle of the moot there used to be a hunting lodge where king Edmand used to hunt .He hunted in what is Melchet court now. At the gate there are 2 big stones under the ground.A man thinks that they are foundations of a great gate that leads to the hunting lodge .Where the moot was there is a pond but when it was used for a saxon meeting place it was dry and there were no reeds or bushes there.Next to the moot there is a staddle barn where someone used to put their corn or wheat in to keep the rats from eating it.We dont know how old the staddle barn is but it must be very old because the planks of wood weren't sawn, they were split.
